title: Hearst Units Vanquish Fired Worker’s Covid Vaccine Bias Claims
text: Two Hearst Corp. units secured a pre-trial end to a suit alleging they discriminated against a worker because of his religion and disability when he refused to get vaccinated against Covid-19 and lost his job. The fired worker’s anti-vaccine belief isn’t religious in nature, and Hearst Stations Inc. didn’t regard him as already suffering from a Covid-19 infection, the US District Court for the District of Massachusetts [said](https://www.bloomberglaw.com/public/document/RodriquevHearstCommcnsIncNo2212152RGS2024BL57908DMassFeb222024Cou?doc_id=XFFNKVF0000N) Thursday. The worker also failed to offer any evidence that co-defendant Hearst Communications Inc. employed him, the court added, granting summary judgment in both companies’ favor.
